Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "add the replace attribute in location for hooking in beforeEach" (#1906) at vuejs/vue-router
Closed issue "Using router-link in v-for, children are treated as root path" (#1905) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[http://jsfiddle.net/avizuber/c1mo5371/8/](http://jsfiddle.net/avizuber/c1mo5371/8/)

### Steps to reproduce
Click on "Home", "Foo", "Projects". These are all root paths. Then click (or just hover over to see url in bottom-left of browser) "Web" and "Mobile".

### What is expected?
Per the docs, children without a slash, e.g. path: 'foo', should be rendered as '/parent/foo'

### What is actually happening?
Children are being treated as root paths. Instead of  '/projects/web', it is '/web'.

---
Could be "solved" be manually setting path to '/parent/child' in the path of each child. Seems to conflict with docs.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

### Steps to reproduce
Click on "Home", "Foo", "Projects". These are all root paths. Then click (or just hover over to see url in bottom-left of browser) "Web" and "Mobile".

### What is expected?

### What is actually happening?

Could be "solved" be manually setting path to '/parent/child' in the path of each child. Seems to conflict with docs.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "LocalStorage.getItem() not works in vuex's getters" (#1070) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.5.0

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/chrisvfritz/50wL7mdz/](https://jsfiddle.net/chrisvfritz/50wL7mdz/)

### Steps to reproduce
    user(state) {
        return localStorage.getItem("something")
    }

### What is expected?
the value of something

### What is actually happening?
null

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
